L-Dopa is combined with carbidopa in the treatment of parkinsonism to enhance the efficacy of L-Dopa by inhibiting its peripheral conversion to dopamine. This allows more L-Dopa to reach the CNS, where it is converted to dopamine, alleviating parkinsonism symptoms. Carbidopa inhibits the enzyme DOPA decarboxylase in the periphery, reducing peripheral side effects and allowing for lower doses of L-Dopa to be used while maintaining therapeutic efficacy.
